greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sigma^n(n), where sigma^n denotes functional iteration.
comment: a(8) = a(9). Are there any other numbers m, n such that a(m) = a(n)? a(16) < a(15); a(25) < a(24). How often is a(n+1) < a(n)?
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(k=sigma(n)); for(n=2, n, k=sigma(k)); k; \\ _Seiichi Manyama_, May 08 2021
results.author: Gabriel Cunningham (gcasey(AT)mit.edu), Feb 25 2004
